explanation: Agent A is correct: as shown, the call strcmp(stream->stream_name, Filename) can scan past the end of either object if the corresponding buffer does not contain a NUL within its bounds. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 requires that uses of <string.h> functions must not be able to access beyond the bounds of the objects referenced. In the posted code Filename is only checked for non-NULL (OS_CHECK_POINTER) and not proven NUL-terminated; stream_name is a fixed-size char[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN] but there is no shown invariant or check that guarantees it contains a terminating '\0'. Without a demonstrated guarantee (e.g. documented API invariant or code that always NUL-terminates when populating stream_name and Filename), the strcmp call is potentially out-of-bounds and thus violates Rule 21.17. If elsewhere in the codebase there is a provable invariant that both strings are NUL-terminated within their arrays, then the call would be compliant — but based solely on the provided code and definitions the report of a violation is correct. Suggested fixes: ensure both buffers are NUL-terminated when written, or use a bounded comparison (e.g. strncmp with OS_MAX_PATH_LEN and ensure termination) or otherwise compare using known, bounded lengths.
